speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne?  Anybody home? _He soon realizes that nobody else is home.  He lifts the seat of the piano stool to see if his book is inside, then sits down and begins to play a Mozart tune on the piano.  Knowing no-one else will hear, he plays the opening chords of a Jerry Lee Lewis classic, then the next ones, until suddenly:_

speaker: Frasier
text: You shake my nerves and you rattle my brain! Too much love drives a man insane! Oh, what a thrill, just what a thrill! Goodness gracious, great balls of fire! _Enjoying this rare moment to himself, he plays and signs with joyous abandon, finishing with a ripple along the keys and a spin around on his stool.  However, when Niles and Martin walk in on him, he goes back to sedately playing the Mozart tune, as if he was playing it all along.  Martin and Niles sit down._

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Niles:_] I still think you're making too big a deal out of this!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I have never seen Maris this angry.  I swear, her eye was twitching like a frog in a science experiment.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, when your mother'd get mad at me, I'd just grab her, bend her backwards, and give her a kiss which made her glad she was a woman!

speaker: Niles
text: I can't do that with Maris.  She has abnormally rigid vertebrae, she'd snap like a twig.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let me guess, Maris has moved into the east wing again?

speaker: Niles
text: Sunday was her fortieth birthday.  She said in no uncertain terms she wanted no acknowledgement of it whatsoever, and in a moment I live over and over in my dreams, I believed her.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, no gifts?  No party?  No nothing?

speaker: Niles
text: Say that weeping into an ermine lap robe and you've got her down perfectly.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, why don't you just get her a nice bottle of perfume?

speaker: Niles
text: She gets hives.

speaker: Martin
text: How about candy?

speaker: Niles
text: Hypoglycemic.

speaker: Martin
text: Just get her a dozen roses.

speaker: Niles
text: Allergic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well listen Niles, why don't you just sit her down and have a little talk, tell her it was a mistake.  We've all noticed she's a bit touchy about her age, even though it's not the first time she's turned forty. [_Martin and Frasier laugh_]

speaker: Niles
text: I know!  I'll throw a great big party for her this weekend. [_gets up and heads for the door_] It'll be a costume ball -- with a Louis Quatorze theme, right down to the powdered wigs and the crushed velvet pantaloons! [_brightly_] May I presume you're both coming down with colds?

speaker: Niles
text: And so it goes. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen dad, you didn't happen to find a book lying around here?  The station manager loaned it to me and I promised I'd return it today.

speaker: Martin
text: What's it called?

speaker: Frasier
text: _The Life And Times Of Sir Herbert Beerbohm Tree._  It's a stunningly witty history of the English theatre.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic:_] Oh OK, you caught me, I got it hidden under my pillow!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you could at least try to be a little bit helpful, I promised him I'd return it today.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, ask Daphne when she comes in.  She was looking for something too put her to sleep last night, that book sounds like it could put her into a coma. _Martin exits and Frasier is left alone.  After mulling it over in his head he decides to go into Daphne's room and retrieve it.  CUT TO: Daphne's Room This room was once Frasier's study, but now shows unmistakable signs of a woman's touch.  He enters cautiously, being careful not to knock anything over.  He picks up the book and is just about to leave when something catches his eye.  He sees that Daphne has kept a lot of photos on her cabinet.  He picks one up to look at it more closely: it is Daphne with Prince Charles.  He has a look at some trinkets before moving to the other side of the room.  He picks up an alarm clock in the shape of a "Teletubby" and shakes it a little.  Spotting a bottle of pills he picks them up and moves over to the light so he can read the label.  At that moment Daphne walks in, and Frasier hastily puts them out of view into his pocket._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: What are you doing in my room?

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I thought you were out... not that I make a habit of coming in here when you're out!  Well, I thought I came in to get my book which I have, see. [_laughs nervously_] Well, I'll just be going - me and my book.  See Frasier go. [_exits_] _FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Apartment. That evening, Niles is on the phone to Maris at Frasier's apartment. Frasier and Martin are sitting at the dinner table._

speaker: Niles
text: [_into phone:_] Nadia, you tell Mrs. Crane I want to speak to her and don't take no for an answer!

speaker: Niles
text: [_firm_] Well then Nadia, you tell her that Dr. Crane says... [_ducks behind the stereo cabinet and lowers his voice_] Please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please, please...

speaker: Martin
text: Maris hung up on you, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: No, now she's got Nadia doing her dirty work.  Nadia is Maris's hatchet maid.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened to that Louis the French guy birthday party?

speaker: Niles
text: Disaster there too!  Maris reminded me that an entire branch of her family tree were slaughtered by the Huguenots.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's just forget about Maris for the time being, shall we?  Sit down and have a nice meal in a convivial atmosphere. _Daphne walks in with a lump of cold meat on a board.  She slams it down in front of Frasier and walks out again._

speaker: Niles
text: What is she mad about?

speaker: Martin
text: Beats me!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering with onions and carrots:_] Here's your favorite, Mr. Crane, cream onions. [_hands them to Martin_] And, Dr. Crane, I've made my special glazed carrots just for you.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you. [_takes them from her_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier:_] You.  Carve! [_she stabs a knife into the meat_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we don't know what she's mad at, but we sure as hell know who!

speaker: Daphne
text: If anyone needs me, I'll be eating in my room. [_to Frasier:_] You know where that is! [_exits_]

speaker: Martin
text: What did you do?

speaker: Frasier
text: This morning, I went into her bedroom.

speaker: Niles
text: [_shocked:_] Frasier, how could you?!  No matter how irresistible the urge to venture down that hallway... to press your face against that door... [_trailing off:_] to actually feel the grain of the wood against your cheek... It must be fought! It must be fought-

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles!  I simply went in there to retrieve my book.

speaker: Martin
text: You're not supposed to go in there!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_defensive_] Oh, what's the big deal?

speaker: Martin
text: Do you ever see her leave her door open?  She doesn't like people going in there.

speaker: Frasier
text: She goes into my room all the time, and it doesn't bother me!

speaker: Martin
text: Women are different.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, that is sexism talking.

speaker: Martin
text: No, that's thirty-five years of marriage talking.  Women protect their privacy.  You know how they are about their handbags.  You never go in there!  It's always "bring me my purse."  The husband could say, "honey, I'm being robbed, the guy's holding a gun to my head and I don't have any money," the wife'd say, "bring me my purse."

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, as usual, your simple homespun wisdom has pricked the balloon of Frasier's pomposity.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Frasier:_] Now you were wrong, so go on in there and apologize.  Go on!

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright!  I'll go into Daphne's room and I will apologize to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alone, Niles!  _CUT TO: Daphne's Room. Daphne is eating her dinner at her desk.  There is a knock at the door._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nicely:_] Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, it's Dr. Crane.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_angry:_] Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Could you open the door, please? _CUT TO: Hallway. Frasier stands outside the door.  Daphne opens the door a crack and stares straight at him, even worse than Eddie._

speaker: Frasier
text: I, I behaved very insensitively this morning.  And I did need the book but it was wrong of me to go in without your permission.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: It'll never happen again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ever.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm being very nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, good night Daphne. [_begins to leave_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_coming out:_] Oh, wait, I'm being much too hard on you! I'm just a little sensitive about my privacy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, there's no need to explain.  I promise you, it will never be an issue again!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, thank you for being so understanding.  I suppose my problem goes back to growing up in a household of boys. My brothers were all snoops.  They never gave me a moment's peace.  Oh, it was a filthy little rite of passage for the Moon boys: when I reached a certain age, they'd sneak into the bathroom and peek at me in the shower.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!  All eight of them?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, except for my brother Billy, the ballroom dancer. He never peeked at me.  Though he did peek at my brother Nigel. _Thinking about it, she exits to her room.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **INDIANA CRANE AND THE DISPOSAL OF DOOM** _Scene Three -- Kitchen. Later that evening, Frasier is making coffee as Martin enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Coffee, dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Why not?  I'm up six times a night anyway, I might as well be alert! _Frasier pours beans into the coffee grinder.  Niles comes in with some dishes.  Martin switches on the disposal unit.  There's a hum indicating it's jammed._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh geez, the disposal's jammed! [_to Niles:_] Yeah, stick your hand down there, see what's stuck, will ya?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, it's me, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: I can't get my hand in there.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh alright, punish a man for being fine-boned.  Are you sure it's off?

speaker: Martin
text: Positive. [_reaches toward the switch to demonstrate_]

speaker: Niles
text: Ah-ah-ah!  Move away from the switch!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, geez... _He moves to the other side of the kitchen.  Niles puts his hand down into the unit._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh-ho, it's wet and slimy and God knows what, it's like sticking my hand into the mouth of hell... _Frasier switches on the coffee grinder, creating a high-pitched buzzing noise._

speaker: Niles
text: YAAAH! _Niles's hand shoots out of the garbage disposal with such force (or little force knowing Niles) that he falls back onto the counter, knocking over Frasier's silver coffee service.  Realizing where the sound came from, he gets to his feet as if nothing has happened (after checking his hand)._  [_N.B. In an earlier draft, Niles holds up his hand while shielding his eyes and yelping for someone to count his fingers._]

speaker: Martin
text: Give me a call when the coffee's ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry, Niles. [_going to pick up the service_] Thank God.

speaker: Niles
text: That's enough excitement for one evening, I'm going home to Maris.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought she wasn't speaking to you.

speaker: Niles
text: She's not, but she grows weary of being frosty to the help.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, by the way I'm out of cash, I need something to tip your garage attendant.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_searches pockets and finds the pill bottle_] Oh, great!

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: These pills!

speaker: Niles
text: I was thinking money but you know him better than I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, [_hands Niles a dollar bill_] Daphne's prescription. When I was in her room earlier, I must have inadvertently... [_thinks_] knocked them into my pocket.

speaker: Niles
text: That's an interesting phenomenon.  I can't walk through a drug store without aspirin and decongestant leaping into my trousers!

speaker: Frasier
text: OK, I was snooping around a little bit. [_he reads the label_] Oh, dear God!  "Take one before bedtime."  Oh no, she's sure to miss these tonight.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering with exercise mat_] Oh, you heading off, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I am.

speaker: Daphne
text: Say hello to your wife.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll certainly try.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, time for your exercises! [_leaves to Martin's room_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh great, this is my chance.  I'll just sneak back there and put these back in her room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alone, Niles! _Frasier goes to enter her bedroom.  As he does so, Daphne and Martin argue off stage.  Frasier carries on._

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s._] The Sonics game's on!  I'll do my exercises tomorrow.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_o.s._] Fine!  If you need me I'll be in my room. _Frasier has just put the pills down, now he can't escape.  He looks for some place to hide, he looks out of the window but it's too far down. He realizes he can't get under the bed so he hides in the wardrobe closet.  Daphne re-enters, calling over her shoulder._

speaker: Daphne
text: You're doing a double set tomorrow!

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s._] Yeah, yeah...

speaker: Daphne
text: Grumpy old sod... _Daphne goes into her bathroom to wash her hands.  Frasier walks out of the wardrobe and heads for the door, but Daphne walks back in, making Frasier rush back into the wardrobe.  Through the slats in the closet door he can see into the room.  Daphne then begins humming "The Blue Danube" as she does her routine. She swallows one of her pills with a glass of water, then begins to undress.  Frasier, mortified, turns away as she takes her underwear off and slings them into the cupboard.  She reaches her hand in, searching for something, so Frasier hurries up the process by passing over her dressing gown.  She puts this on whilst Frasier closes the wardrobe door.  Daphne goes to shut the wardrobe door and sees it already is.  She just thinks she already closed it.  Then she heads for the bathroom, so Frasier again tries to head to the door.  However, Daphne comes out again so he ducks behind the bed.  She moves over to that side of the bed, so he runs over to the other side, where she doesn't notice him.  After putting her eye drops in and untying her hair she heads to the wardrobe to take out some towels.  Frasier hurries off into the bathroom out of sight.  With the towels, Daphne waddles into the bathroom, still humming.  Frasier is hiding behind the door, as Daphne disrobes herself and gets into the shower.  Eddie comes running in and begins drinking from the toilet.  Daphne sees him._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Eddie:_] What are you doing?  It's disgusting, you filthy thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: Get out of here right now, get out!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, I'm so sorry!  _Daphne SCREAMS loudly, causing Frasier to run out, also screaming.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Caf e Nervosa The following day, Frasier is sat at a table.  Niles prances in, a little bit full of himself because of some events the night before in the Maris Mansion._

speaker: Niles
text: Good morning, Frasier!

speaker: Niles
text: _Cara mia, uno mezzo latte decaffinato_ , and a bran muffin. No, no... [_kisses her hand_] _due_ bran muffins. [_to Frasier_] Maris and I burned up a lot of energy last night - [_gleefully_] a LOT of energy! -- and I have to replenish my body. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I assume you and Maris achieved detente.

speaker: Niles
text: Twice!

speaker: Frasier
text: What magic words did you use to melt your little glacier?

speaker: Niles
text: I got home, I sat her down, I stared deeply into her eyes... and I said, "Maris, here are the keys to your new Mercedes."

speaker: Frasier
text: You bought her a Mercedes?

speaker: Niles
text: [_happily_] Yes -- oh, the things that tiny woman can do when she's properly motivated.

speaker: Frasier
text: If you're through marinating in your own testosterone, I have a problem.  Remember last night I went back into Daphne's room?  Well, she caught me again.

speaker: Niles
text: You're joking!

speaker: Frasier
text: I was just so embarrassed I had to leave this morning before she woke up.  I left a little note, trying to explain my actions.  Considering the circumstances, I don't think there's any way she can forgive me!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come now.  It wasn't as bad as all that.  It's not like you saw her naked or something.

speaker: Niles
text: You did!

speaker: Frasier
text: But I took no pleasure in it at all!  The entire thing was just absolutely mortifying!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I want to help you with this, so you have to tell me everything.  Every sight, every sound -- Frasier, unburden yourself before you explode! [_he says about to explode himself_]

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, no!

speaker: Niles
text: Alright then, I'll show you how I've always imagined her and you tell me where I'm wrong!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see you.

speaker: Roz
text: So Niles, you randy dog, you got lucky last night, didn't you? [_Niles reacts_] I can always tell. [_looks at Frasier_] Oh, don't worry, you'll meet somebody. [_to waitress_] Can I have a non- fat cap, please?

speaker: Niles
text: Roz, this was a private conversation, I'm helping my brother with a matter of some delicacy.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't worry, Shower Boy told me all about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: I just don't see that there's any way I can make it up to Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, nothing says I'm sorry like a in-dash CD player and a passenger side airbag!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Roz:_] Maris was upset with Niles so he bought her a Mercedes.

speaker: Roz
text: Woof!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles:_] And if you're suggesting that I buy my way out of my problem, the answer is no!  It's the coward's way out!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, so I'm a coward?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm a coward with a hickey!

speaker: Roz
text: Buy me a Mercedes and I'll make your neck look like a relief map of the Andes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, don't encourage him, I happen to think that bribery is the wrong way for couples to resolve their conflicts!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh really, and during which of your failed marriages did you hone that theory?! **PEACE AT ANY COST** _Scene Five -- Apartment -- Night. In Frasier's living room, Martin needs some advice as Frasier comes in the front door._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I'm glad to see you.  I need some advice. I've got this son who's a total numbnut.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, dad.  Love your icebreaker!

speaker: Martin
text: You'd better get her to stay, Frasier.  She knows my moods, she's knows how to handle me, and I like her.

speaker: Frasier
text: She's talking about quitting?

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, so get in there and apologize!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dad, I can't go in there!

speaker: Martin
text: No, of course you can't, because I asked you to go in there. When I said, "don't go in there" what did you do?  You went in there.  Now I say go in there and you won't!  That's what I like about Eddie, he always does what I tell him to.  Come on, Eddie. _As Martin exits, Eddie tries to follow him, but Frasier holds him by the tail._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] He's defying you too, dad! _Daphne has entered without Frasier noticing.  When he does, she makes a beeline for the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, Daphne, please, please wait, we've gotta talk.  I feel absolutely terrible.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sympathetic_] Oh, now, Dr. Crane, your note explained everything, you've got nothing to feel bad about.

speaker: Frasier
text: That puts my mind at ease.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sarcastic_] A servant like me doesn't deserve privacy anyway!  Matter of fact, why don't we just get it all out in the open?

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's my bank book, some personal letters, oh and my driver's license.  As you can see, I'm four pounds heavier now, but it's in a spot that doesn't really show... TO MOST PEOPLE!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh look, Daphne, I realize how hard it is to live in someone else's home.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, it is!  But I put up with it, because I happen to love this job.  All I ever asked for was one room, a little corner I could call my own.  I never minded if I was up to my eyeballs in your precious earth tones and your African knick-knacks, but now I have to put up with you in there, too.  And that's one leering love god too many!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Daphne, you're absolutely right, you do deserve a place of your own.  Listen if you agree to stay, [_desperate:_] I'll I'll have your room redecorated.  Just make it your own. Paint, wallpaper, upholstery, anything you'd like.  Just so you feel comfortable.

speaker: Daphne
text: How about an electrified fence and a German police dog?

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, I promise, as long as we live under the same roof together, I will never ever set foot in your room again.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_pauses_] Alright.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll give it another try.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Niles!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Dr. Crane. [_to Frasier_] Goodbye, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, where are you off to?

speaker: Daphne
text: I have some shopping to do.  Your brother just offered to pay to have my room re-decorated.

speaker: Niles
text: [_slyly:_] Oh, really?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm thinking of doing the whole thing in pinks and yellows.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, she's really determined to keep me out of there.

speaker: Niles
text: So, you're putting things right with Daphne by opening up your checkbook?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I know what you're thinking, and believe me, it's just a gesture.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I see.  I give Maris a car, it's a bribe.  When you re-decorate Daphne's room, it's a gesture.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, our two situations are entirely different.  You bought Maris off because you are afraid of her.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh I see, and you're not the slightest bit intimidated by Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: Then you wouldn't be at all alarmed if I were to, say, do this. [_runs to the hallway_]

speaker: Frasier
text: But... Niles!  Niles, where are you going? _CUT TO: Hallway Niles runs up to the corridor outside Daphne's room and opens the door. He puts his foot over the door line._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh look, my foot's in Daphne's room.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just get out of there.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pulls his foot back_] What's the matter?  Are you afraid you'll get... [_jumps across the threshold_] in trouble?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: [_jumps back out_] Now we're safe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it!

speaker: Niles
text: [_in_] Trouble. [_out_] Safe. [_in_] Trouble. [_out_] Safe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you're acting like a child!

speaker: Niles
text: [_more rapidly_] Trouble, safe, trouble, safe, trouble, safe! _Frasier is getting extremely hot under the collar because of this. He tries to stop him, until Niles knocks over Daphne's jewelry tree, spilling her necklaces and earrings all over the carpet._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, no!  You see what you've done now!  She's bound to find out!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, [_snooping around_] so you'll just write her a bigger, fatter check.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, she'll quit!

speaker: Niles
text: WHAT?!  Why didn't you say something- _Turning around in shock, Niles spills his sherry on the bed, causing them both to panic further.  Niles grabs a towel from the bottom of a pile of Daphne's laundry, scattering it everywhere, and looking for more things to cover the stain.  He ends up in Daphne's underwear and nightie drawer, and starts flinging her under-clothes onto the bed.  Martin comes in to see what the upset is, and Eddie follows him._

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell are you two doing in here?!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all Niles's fault!

speaker: Niles
text: It is not!

speaker: Frasier
text: Never mind, just help us clean up this mess! _Martin falls onto the bed trying to mop up the sherry, and Niles, who is still throwing underwear, throws it on Martin.  Daphne appears in the doorway and freezes as she takes in the scene along with the camera: - Frasier on the floor, pawing through her jewelry - Martin on her bed underneath her lingerie - Niles shielding himself from her stare with one of her nighties - Eddie sitting up with one of her bras in his teeth  FADE TO:  Scene Six -- Car Dealership Lot It isn't long before Daphne and Frasier are at a car salesroom. Daphne is sitting inside a large blue Mustang convertible, wearing a head scarf similar to Louise's from "Thelma and Louise."  Eddie is sitting in the passenger seat. _

speaker: Daphne
text: [_as the hood retracts, happily_] Oooooh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, did you happen to see that sporty little sub-compact over there?  I bet you could park that anywhere.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is that a Mercedes dealership across the street? _Frasier pushes her back down.  END OF ACT TWO (Time: 21:30)_
